newsitem.title: GERMANY: Istanbul-bound plane hijacked to Germany.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul-bound plane hijacked to Germany.

text.p: An Air Malta plane with 85 people on board was hijacked to Germany early on Monday on a flight from Malta to Istanbul, German police said.

The Boeing 737 airliner carrying 79 adults, one child and five crew members landed unexpectedly at Cologne-Bonn airport at 4.47 a.m. (0247 GMT) and was standing in the freight section there, a police spokesman at the airport told Reuters.
It had been headed to Istanbul from Malta.
"Police have started a dialogue with the hijacker and I hope that will prove constructive," Heinz Gombel, chief executive of the airport, told reporters.
The police spokesman said a Turkish interpreter had been called to the airport, indicating the hijacker might be from Turkey.
One woman had been allowed to leave the plane because she had heart problems.
The hijacker requested that a television crew come to the plane to act as mediators, Gombel said.
